Fantasy adventure, with Ryan Reynolds and Jeff Bridges.(n)

programme.title: The Thing
programme.desc: A mysterious shape-shifting alien kills and impersonates its victims on an Antarctic research base manned by a crew of American scientists. The researchers face the ordeal of stopping the creature from making its way to civilisation - but are in danger of jeopardising the task as mounting paranoia turns them against each other. John Carpenter's sci-fi horror remake, starring Kurt Russell, Wilford Brimley, TK Carter, Keith David and Richard Dysart.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Countdown of the biggest box office hits in Britain and America.(n)

programme.title: I Still Know What You Did Last Summer
programme.desc: Julie James, the survivor of the original bloody events, sets off for a holiday in the Bahamas - but as soon as she arrives, her arch-enemy returns from the dead, forcing her into a desperate battle for survival. Horror sequel, starring Jennifer Love Hewitt, Freddie Prinze Jnr, Brandy Norwood and Mekhi Phifer.(n)

programme.title: House on Haunted Hill
programme.desc: An eccentric tycoon challenges five mismatched people to spend a night in a spooky mansion, a former asylum, and promises them $1million each if they manage to stay the course - but events take a shocking turn as a murderous entity returns to satisfy its blood lust. Remake of the 1958 horror, starring Geoffrey Rush, Famke Janssen and Taye Diggs.(n)

programme.title: Project: ALF
programme.desc: A lovable alien is captured by the US army who plan to destroy him, prompting two officers to come to his aid. Spin-off from the sci-fi comedy TV series, with Miguel Ferrer, Ed Begley Jr and Martin Sheen.(n)

programme.title: Fright Night 2
programme.desc: Two American high-school students travelling through Romania discover a college professor is really a vampire. When one of them finds out that the bloodsucker plans to sacrifice his ex-girlfriend, he turns to an old pal - now hosting a reality TV show - for help in slaying the undead academic. Comedy horror remake sequel, with Will Payne and Jaime Murray.(n)

programme.title: Black Christmas
programme.desc: A crazed maniac, committed to a mental hospital for murdering his mother, breaks out at Christmas and returns to his childhood home. Enraged to find it is now a sorority house, he sets about murdering the students living there one by one. Remake of the 1970s horror, starring Katie Cassidy and Michelle Trachtenberg.(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: An explorer discovers a prehistoric monster-infested world deep beneath Earth's crust and faces a tough ordeal escaping the predatory attacks of the creatures as he tries to guide his team back to safety. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Pat Boone, James Mason, Arlene Dahl and Diane Baker.(n)

programme.title: Interstellar: Nolan's Odyssey
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Christopher Nolan's sci-fi drama, which stars Matthew McConaughey and Anne Hathaway.(n)

programme.title: Mama
programme.desc: A man takes in his two nieces, who have been left to fend for themselves for years in a forest after their parents' deaths. He and his girlfriend try to give the almost animalistic children a normal life, unaware that a supernatural force that looked after the girls in the wild has followed them home. Horror, starring Jessica Chastain and Nikolaj Coster-Waldau.(n)

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: The Marked Ones
programme.desc: A teenager investigates the murder of a neighbour, which leads him to discover evidence of black magic. He begins to experience strange and disturbing changes and realises he may be succumbing to a sinister curse placed on him by a coven of witches and their demonic allies. Horror sequel, starring Andrew Jacobs and Jorge Diaz.(n)

programme.title: The Borderlands
programme.desc: Two paranormal investigators working for the Vatican are sent to a remote church in the West Country to investigate reports of supernatural activity. They set up a network of cameras in the building, but what they record proves far more terrifying than anyone expected. Found-footage horror, starring Gordon Kennedy and Aidan McArdle.(n)

programme.title: Fright Night 2
programme.desc: Two American high-school students travelling through Romania discover a college professor is really a vampire. programme.title: The Reef 2: High Tide
programme.desc: A shark who was driven away from a reef plots revenge by getting his sidekick to infiltrate the undersea community disguised as a less dangerous sea creature. However, the plucky fish that once defeated the aquatic predator sees through the ruse and tries to foil the evil plan. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Drake Bell and Busy Philipps.(n)

programme.title: I, Frankenstein
programme.desc: The infamous scientist's monster roams the Earth 200 years after burying his creator, and is drawn into an ancient supernatural conflict. Two factions of magical beings are at war, and the key to ending the conflict lies in tapping the secret of the creature's immortality. Fantasy adventure, starring Aaron Eckhart, Bill Nighy and Miranda Otto.(n)

programme.title: Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa
programme.desc: A debauched old man makes a bizarre road trip across America to reunite his eight-year-old grandson with his real father. He takes the youngster through funerals, beauty pageants and biker bars and treats the people he meets to a display of his twisted approach to childcare. Hidden camera comedy, starring Johnny Knoxville and Jackson Nicoll.(n)

programme.title: Identity Thief
programme.desc: A con-woman acquires an executive's credit card numbers, and lives a life of luxury at his expense. The outraged victim sets out on a mission to track down the fraudster and bring her to justice personally - resulting in them travelling on a disastrous road trip across America together. Comedy, with Jason Bateman, Melissa McCarthy, Jon Favreau and Amanda Peet.(n)

programme.title: Muppets Most Wanted
programme.desc: The Muppets prepare to head off on a world tour, unaware that Kermit has been replaced by an evil genius who is his exact double. As the dastardly interloper uses the gang's performances as cover for an international crime spree, the real Kermit is left languishing in a Russian prison. Comedy, starring Ricky Gervais, Tina Fey and Ty Burrell.(n)

programme.title: Elysium
programme.desc: In the future, most of the human race exists in poverty on a ruined Earth, while a wealthy elite live in luxury on an orbiting space station. A man dying of radiation poisoning fights security forces to gain access to the satellite and its medical facilities. Sci-fi thriller from the director of District 9, starring Matt Damon, Jodie Foster and Sharlto Copley.(n)

programme.title: The World's End
programme.desc: A 40-year-old man who refuses to grow up drags four reluctant childhood friends back to their home town to recreate a pub crawl they attempted in their teens. As they work their way round the 12 local bars, they stumble on a threat to the entire human race. Fantasy comedy, starring Simon Pegg, Nick Frost and Martin Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Muppets Most Wanted

Hidden camera comedy, starring Johnny Knoxville and Jackson Nicoll.(n)

programme.title: Spring Breakers
programme.desc: Four teenage girls are desperate to enjoy a wild spring holiday in Florida, and resort to robbery to fund it. Their brush with the law brings them to the attention of a sleazy gangster, who seduces them further into a life of crime while giving them the hedonistic experiences they crave. Drama, starring James Franco and Selena Gomez.(n)

programme.title: The Good Witch's Wonder
programme.desc: Small-town shopkeeper Cassandra is struggling to organise her stepson's new wedding, so takes on a secretive new arrival in town to help her in the store. When a series of thefts sweep the town, suspicion turns to the newcomer. Cassandra tries to discover who is really to blame, while also finding out what her new friend is hiding. Drama sequel, starring Catherine Bell and Chris Potter.(n)

programme.title: Jack the Giant Slayer
programme.desc: A farm boy accidentally rebuilds the link between the human world and a kingdom of man-eating giants in the sky, resulting in a princess being trapped in the monsters' realm. He joins a band of the king's knights on a rescue mission, but one of the group intends to betray them in a bid to seize the throne. Fantasy adventure, starring Nicholas Hoult and Ewan McGregor.(n)

programme.title: White House Down
programme.desc: A policeman is turned down for his dream job as a secret service bodyguard to the president. While taking his daughter on a tour of the White House, he gets the chance to prove himself when terrorists seize control of the building, putting the head of state's life in his hands. Action thriller, with Channing Tatum, Jamie Foxx, Maggie Gyllenhaal and James Woods.(n)

programme.title: Iron Man 3
programme.desc: The armoured avenger hunts for the mastermind behind an untraceable series of bombings, despite being cut off from his usual resources and traumatised by a recent brush with death. His search uncovers a secret conspiracy involving a drug that renders the user indestructible. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Gwyneth Paltrow and Don Cheadle.(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious 6
programme.desc: A gang of fugitives is reunited by an FBI manhunter, who offers the criminals pardons in return for their help. They must go to Europe and bring down a criminal syndicate led by a ruthless London gangster, whose right-hand woman is an old friend of theirs assumed to be dead. Action thriller sequel, with Vin Diesel, Dwayne Johnson and Michelle Rodriguez.(n)

programme.title: Kick-Ass 2
programme.desc: Amateur superhero Dave joins a team of like-minded crimefighters, while lethal young vigilante Mindy retires and tries to be a normal teenager. Both of them become targets of Dave's twisted former friend, who has reinvented himself as the world's first supervillain. Action comedy sequel, starring Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Chloe Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse and Jim Carrey.(n)

programme.title: White House Down

programme.title: The Host
programme.desc: Earth is invaded by parasitic aliens which possess humans, but one of the creatures discovers the consciousness of her teenage host has not been fully repressed. The human part of their personality persuades her to turn her back on her race and seek out free humans, leading her to a resistance group fighting to free mankind. Sci-fi adventure, starring Saoirse Ronan, Max Irons and William Hurt.(n)

programme.title: Romeo & Juliet
programme.desc: The children of two feuding noble houses fall in love, and marry in secret with the aid of a wily priest who hopes to reconcile the two families. However, when the conflict flares up again with fatal consequences, it sets in motion a chain of events that will drive the lovers apart. Adaptation of Shakespeare's tragedy, starring Douglas Booth, Hailee Steinfeld and Paul Giamatti.(n)

programme.title: Godzilla
programme.desc: A giant mutant lizard spawned from an atomic test rampages through the streets of New York, defying the combined might of the US Army and Navy as it searches for a quiet place to hatch its eggs. A bookish radiation expert and a shady French secret agent join forces to defeat the creature. Hollywood remake of the Japanese monster adventure, starring Matthew Broderick, Jean Reno, Maria Pitillo and Hank Azaria.(n)

programme.title: This Is the End
programme.desc: A group of movie stars gathers in Hollywood for a glamorous housewarming party, only to be faced with the Biblical apocalypse. As demons overrun the world, the celebrities go into hiding, and must rise above their own selfishness if they are to survive. Fantasy comedy, starring James Franco, Jonah Hill, Emma Watson, Michael Cera and co-director Seth Rogen as themselves.(n)

programme.title: Pacific Rim
programme.desc: A rift between dimensions opens up at the bottom of the Pacific ocean, and Earth is invaded by gigantic alien monsters. Equally massive robots, each controlled by two human pilots with their minds linked, are created to fight back against the creatures. Sci-fi adventure, starring Charlie Hunnam, Rinko Kikuchi and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Pain & Gain: Sky Movies Special
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of Michael Bay's crime comedy starring Mark Wahlberg, Dwayne Johnson and Anthony Mackie as bodybuilders mixed up in a kidnapping plot.(n)

programme.title: The Lego Movie
programme.desc: An ordinary man leading a life of blissful ignorance in a city made of the construction toy is mistakenly identified as a chosen one destined to save the universe. He joins a mismatched band of heroes in stopping a plan to fix the world permanently in place. Animated comedy, with the voices of Chris Pratt, Elizabeth Banks, Morgan Freeman and Will Ferrell.(n)

programme.title: Elysium
programme.desc: In the future, most of the human race exists in poverty on a ruined Earth, while a wealthy elite live in luxury on an orbiting space station. programme.title: Delhi Safari
programme.desc: The animals living in an Indian forest decide something has to be done when their home is threatened by developers. A leopard and her cub travel across the country to Delhi, aided by a bear, a monkey and a parrot who can speak to humans, hoping to persuade the government to intervene. Animated adventure, with the voices of Tara Strong and Vanessa Williams.(n)

programme.title: Hitchcock
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the making of Alfred Hitchcock's Psycho. The film-maker is forced to fund the controversial project personally in the face of disinterest from the studios, while the financial strain and his lecherous behaviour begin to take their toll on his relationship with wife and creative partner Alma Reville. Starring Anthony Hopkins, Helen Mirren and Scarlett Johansson.(n)

programme.title: Primates of the Caribbean
programme.desc: A monkey who guards the beach of a Caribbean island is horrified to uncover a tycoon plans to build a casino in the area. He soon discovers this is just cover for a far more evil scheme, and joins forces with a motley band of simian pirates to save his home from a giant robot. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jason J Lewis, Anthony Jenkins and Phil Meyers.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Doubtfire
programme.desc: A struggling actor's ambitious, no-nonsense wife throws him out and demands a divorce. Desperate to spend time with his children, he puts his talents to good use by donning drag and posing as a Scottish housekeeper to get a job looking after them. Comedy, starring Robin Williams, Sally Field, Pierce Brosnan, Harvey Fierstein and Mara Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Hitchcock

Starring Anthony Hopkins, Helen Mirren and Scarlett Johansson.(n)

programme.title: Captain America: The Winter Soldier
programme.desc: The superhuman soldier becomes an operative for secret intelligence agency SHIELD, but grows suspicious of their motives. Following a battle with a mysterious cyborg assassin, he and fellow Avenger Black Widow become fugitives, and try to bring down a sinister conspiracy. Comic-book thriller sequel, starring Chris Evans, Scarlett Johansson, Samuel L Jackson and Robert Redford.(n)

programme.title: Grown Ups 2
programme.desc: A man moves his family back to the town where he grew up, so his children can have the same upbringing he had. While he and his three childhood friends try to relive their lost youth, they discover their kids have a thing or two to teach them during the last day of school. Comedy sequel, starring Adam Sandler, Chris Rock, Kevin James and David Spade.(n)

programme.title: The Lone Ranger Unmasked
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the Western from the director of Pirates of the Caribbean, starring Armie Hammer and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Battle of the Year
programme.desc: A music mogul is determined to enter a winning team in a prestigious international dance competition that has not seen an American victory in 15 years. He recruits some of the best dancers in the country, and seeks the aid of a former championship basketball coach to teach them to work together. Drama, starring Josh Holloway and Laz Alonso.(n)

programme.title: Nebraska
programme.desc: An elderly alcoholic is mistakenly convinced he has won a sweepstakes prize, and keeps trying to travel from his Montana home to Nebraska to collect it. His son ultimately agrees to drive him there despite knowing it is pointless, but the journey ends abruptly when they become stranded in the town where the old man was born. Drama, starring Bruce Dern and Will Forte.(n)

programme.title: Primates of the Caribbean
programme.desc: A monkey who guards the beach of a Caribbean island is horrified to uncover a tycoon plans to build a casino in the area. He soon discovers this is just cover for a far more evil scheme, and joins forces with a motley band of simian pirates to save his home from a giant robot. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jason J Lewis, Anthony Jenkins and Phil Meyers.(n)

programme.title: The Reef 2: High Tide
programme.desc: A shark who was driven away from a reef plots revenge by getting his sidekick to infiltrate the undersea community disguised as a less dangerous sea creature. However, the plucky fish that once defeated the aquatic predator sees through the ruse and tries to foil the evil plan. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Drake Bell and Busy Philipps.(n)

programme.title: One Chance
programme.desc: Fact-based comedy drama following the rise to fame of amateur opera singer Paul Potts. Throughout his school days as a bullied outsider and mundane adulthood as a mobile phone salesman, he longs to make something of his love of opera, finally getting his opportunity in a TV talent show. Starring James Corden, Julie Walters, Colm Meaney and Mackenzie Crook.(n)

programme.title: Hook
programme.desc: Peter Pan, who has finally grown up and is now a married lawyer with a family of his own, is whisked away by Tinkerbell to Neverland, where he must learn to fly again if he is to save his children from the clutches of Captain Hook. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.(n)

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: A London man's misfortunes in love look set to change when he meets an American beauty. However, the prospect of a transatlantic relationship succeeding seems slim, so the pair go their separate ways - only for him to realise he is unable to get her out of his mind. Richard Curtis's comedy, with Hugh Grant, Andie MacDowell, John Hannah, Charlotte Coleman, Kristin Scott Thomas, Simon Callow and James Fleet.(n)

programme.title: Noah
programme.desc: A man is chosen by God to build an ark capable of housing his family and pairs of every living creature when the world is flooded. However, Noah's mission is complicated by his adopted daughter Ila, and the villainous Tubal-cain, who plans on storming the vessel to escape the Creator's vengeance. Biblical epic, starring Russell Crowe, Ray Winstone and Emma Watson.(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: A married couple of renowned paranormal investigators visit a remote farmhouse for their latest case. They have come to the aid of a family who claim to be terrorised by dark forces, and are confronted by a powerful demonic entity more terrifying than anything they have faced before. Fact-based horror, with Vera Farmiga and Patrick Wilson.(n)

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral

programme.title: Promised Land
programme.desc: A corporate salesman is sent to a town struggling with financial difficulties to obtain rights to drill on the locals' land. However, the task proves far more complicated than expected as a local schoolteacher organises the community while an environmental activist launches his own campaign. Drama, starring Matt Damon and Frances McDormand.(n)

programme.desc: Fact-based comedy drama following the rise to fame of amateur opera singer Paul Potts. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.(n)

programme.title: Chasing Mavericks
programme.desc: A teenager discovers a supposedly legendary stretch of shoreline famous for vast waves actually exists. He tracks down a famous surfer and asks for help in developing his skills to the point where he can successfully ride the challenging waters. Fact-based drama, starring Jonny Weston, Gerard Butler and Elisabeth Shue.(n)

programme.title: Exodus: Gods & Kings - Behind the Scenes
programme.desc: The making of Ridley Scott's biblical epic, starring Christian Bale as Moses.(n)

programme.title: Emperor
programme.desc: An American general involved in the occupation of Japan in the aftermath of the Second World War is given the task of deciding whether Emperor Hirohito should stand trial as a war criminal. His assignment is complicated by his search for his lost love, an exchange student he met in the US years previously. Fact-based drama, with Matthew Fox and Tommy Lee Jones.(n)

programme.title: Austin Powers: The Spy Who S*****d Me
programme.desc: The sex-mad spy is sent back to swinging London at the height of the 1960s in pursuit of the dastardly Dr Evil, who has stolen the secret agent's `mojo'. Teaming up with a female American agent, Austin must stop his arch-rival from causing havoc with a doomsday weapon on the moon. Comedy sequel, starring Mike Myers in multiple roles alongside Heather Graham, Rob Lowe, Robert Wagner, Michael York, Seth Green and Verne Troyer.(n)

programme.title: White House Down
programme.desc: A policeman is turned down for his dream job as a secret service bodyguard to the president. While taking his daughter on a tour of the White House, he gets the chance to prove himself when terrorists seize control of the building, putting the head of state's life in his hands. Action thriller, with Channing Tatum, Jamie Foxx, Maggie Gyllenhaal and James Woods.(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything Special
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the biopic of Stephen Hawking, starring Eddie Redmayne and Felicity Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Internship
programme.desc: Two old-fashioned salesmen find their careers derailed by changes in technology. They nevertheless manage to get internships at an internet company, but face a battle to come to terms with modern business methods, while competing against younger rivals. Comedy, starring Vince Vaughn, Owen Wilson and Rose Byrne.(n)

programme.title: Live FA Cup
programme.desc: Dover Athletic v Crystal Palace (Kick-off 1.00pm). Coverage of the opening clash in a double bill of third-round matches, staged at the Crabble Athletic Ground, as the Conference Premier hosts aim to spring a major surprise against the Eagles. Home fans and neutrals alike will hope a good, old-fashioned cup tie is in store this afternoon, as the Premier League outfit find themselves in less salubrious surroundings than they will be accustomed to. The history of this famous competition is littered with giant-killing exploits featuring lower and non-league teams, and while the Whites will still be considered underdogs for this tie, the romance of the cup could inspire them to perform beyond their wildest expectations, and heap further misery on Palace after they relieved Neil Warnock of his managerial duties following the Boxing Day defeat at home to Southampton.(n)

programme.title: Live FA Cup
programme.desc: Yeovil Town v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.30pm). Coverage from Huish Park of the second match in a double bill, as the third round continues. While United will start as favourites, they will be wary of an upset against lower-league opposition for the second time this season, especially following a hectic festive schedule in the Premier League.(n)

programme.title: Live FA Cup
programme.desc: Dover Athletic v Crystal Palace (Kick-off 1.00pm). Coverage of the opening clash in a double bill of third-round matches, staged at the Crabble Athletic Ground, as the Conference Premier hosts aim to spring a major surprise against the Eagles. Home fans and neutrals alike will hope a good, old-fashioned cup tie is in store this afternoon, as the Premier League outfit find themselves in less salubrious surroundings than they will be accustomed to. The history of this famous competition is littered with giant-killing exploits featuring lower and non-league teams, and while the Whites will still be considered underdogs for this tie, the romance of the cup could inspire them to perform beyond their wildest expectations, and heap further misery on Palace after they relieved Neil Warnock of his managerial duties following the Boxing Day defeat at home to Southampton.(n)

programme.title: Live FA Cup
programme.desc: Yeovil Town v Manchester United (Kick-off 3.30pm). Coverage from Huish Park of the second match in a double bill, as the third round continues. While United will start as favourites, they will be wary of an upset against lower-league opposition for the second time this season, especially following a hectic festive schedule in the Premier League.(n)

El Mm2 Bla V Mid ChampionshipProgrammes
The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes.(n)

programme.title: Johnny English Reborn
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent retires to a Tibetan monastery in disgrace after a mission goes wrong. He is lured out of seclusion by the chance to redeem himself when his former bosses seek his help in foiling an attempt to assassinate the premier of China. Spy comedy sequel, starring Rowan Atkinson, Gillian Anderson, Rosamund Pike and Dominic West.(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: Scientist Trevor Anderson sets out to locate his missing explorer brother after receiving a book charting his last journey. Accompanied by his nephew and an Icelandic guide, he is led to a mountain peak, where he stumbles across a system of caves leading to a lost underground world. Fantasy adventure, starring Brendan Fraser, Josh Hutcherson and Anita Briem.(n)

programme.title: The Muppet Christmas Carol
programme.desc: An embittered Victorian miser hates the festive season and people in general, but on Christmas Eve, the ghosts of his former business partners, the Marley brothers, visit him in the night. They warn him three spirits are coming to make him change his ways by showing him visions of the past, the present and what the future may hold. Comedy, with Michael Caine and Steven Mackintosh alongside the puppet characters.(n)

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: The manager of an apartment complex asks a Wall Street financier to manage pension funds for him and his friends, but the man pockets all the money instead. When he realises the fraudster is going to get away with the crime and the money will never be found, he enlists the help of a professional thief to steal it back. Crime comedy, with Ben Stiller, Eddie Murphy, Alan Alda, Tea Leoni, Casey Affleck and Matthew Broderick. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: A scientist carries out genetic experiments on apes, hoping to find a cure for Alzheimer's disease. A chimpanzee used in the tests develops superior intelligence and becomes outraged at the human race's cruel treatment of his kind, forming his fellow primates into an army to overthrow mankind. Sci-fi thriller, starring James Franco, Freida Pinto and Andy Serkis.(n)

programme.title: Coming to America
programme.desc: A bored African prince defies his father's plans for an arranged marriage and escapes to the USA to find a bride on his own terms. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Arsenio Hall in several roles, with James Earl Jones, Allison Dean, Eriq La Salle and Madge Sinclair.(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs the World
programme.desc: A directionless bassist meets the girl of his dreams, but finds that romancing her comes with a dangerous catch. She has seven evil ex-lovers, all endowed with tremendous fighting skills or superpowers - and before he can go out with her, he is expected to face each one in a battle to the death. Comedy adventure, starring Michael Cera, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and Jason Schwartzman.(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and stars Michael Cera, Jason Schwartzman, Anna Kendrick and Mary Elizabeth Winstead discuss making the comedy adventure based on the comic-book series.(n)

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the children's books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Hugo
programme.desc: An orphan lives in the walls of a 1930s railway station, hiding from the inspector who would send him to an orphanage. He scours the station for parts to complete a clockwork robot belonging to his father, a quest which leads him to uncover a lonely shopkeeper's mysterious past. Martin Scorsese's family adventure, starring Asa Butterfield, Chloe Grace Moretz and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: Teenager Sam Witwicky is treated to his first car by his dad, but it turns out to be an alien scout with a life of its own. Before long, the vehicle embroils Sam in a long-running intergalactic war between two factions of giant shape-changing robots, which have come to Earth to find a mystical cube that grants infinite power to its possessor. Michael Bay's sci-fi action adventure, inspired by the toy franchise, with Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Jon Voight and John Turturro. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything Special
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the biopic of Stephen Hawking, starring Eddie Redmayne and Felicity Jones.(n)

programme.title: Runaway Jury
programme.desc: A woman sets in motion a multimillion-dollar lawsuit against the manufacturer of the gun that was used to kill her husband - but her actions spark an unexpected series of events when a jury consultant for the defence tries to buy the verdict his clients want. Thriller, adapted from a novel by John Grisham, starring John Cusack, Gene Hackman, Dustin Hoffman, Rachel Weisz and Bruce Davison. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: Slumdog Millionaire
programme.desc: An uneducated teenager from the Mumbai slums is only one question away from winning a quiz show, but the authorities are reluctant to believe a youngster from such a humble background could succeed without cheating. Under questioning, he tells a police inspector the eventful story of his life - and how he came to know so much. Danny Boyle's Oscar-winning drama, starring Dev Patel and Freida Pinto.(n)

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with alcoholism is hired as a bodyguard to the daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City - but when the girl is abducted, he swears to exact an explosive revenge on the kidnappers. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning.(n)

programme.title: Weekender
programme.desc: Two Mancunians involved with the rave scene in the early 1990s plan to become party promoters in the face of a government crackdown. Their success brings them wealth and a hedonistic lifestyle, but their friendship is placed under strain as criminal elements muscle in on their business. Drama, starring Jack O'Connell and Henry Lloyd-Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama recounting the bombing of Pearl Harbour from both the Japanese and American perspectives, reconstructing the events leading up to the devastating attack on the US naval base in 1941. Starring Martin Balsam, So Yamamura, Joseph Cotten, James Whitmore and Jason Robards.(n)

credits.actor: EG Marshall (Lt Col Rufus S Bratton)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: A musical prodigy runs away from a children's home to track down his parents, who are unaware of their son's existence. However, when he arrives at his destination, Evan is befriended by a mysterious stranger who may not have the youngster's best interests in mind. Drama, starring Freddie Highmore, Keri Russell, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Terrence Howard and Robin Williams.(n)

programme.title: The Grinch
programme.desc: A little girl residing in the Christmas-obsessed town of Whoville becomes fascinated with a grouchy creature living in the mountains. But her efforts to make him part of their celebrations leave him more bitter than ever, and he resolves to ruin the festive season. Fantasy comedy, based on Dr Seuss's children's book, with Jim Carrey, Taylor Momsen, Jeffrey Tambor and Molly Shannon. Anthony Hopkins narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Zorro
programme.desc: The masked hero investigates a mysterious explosion linked to a French count, who is plotting to prevent California joining the United States - and discovers his wife, who walked out on their marriage when he refused to hang up his sword, is somehow involved. Swashbuckling adventure sequel, starring Antonio Banderas, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Rufus Sewell, Alberto Reyes and Adrian Alonso. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything Special
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the biopic of Stephen Hawking, starring Eddie Redmayne and Felicity Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Hunger Games
programme.desc: A totalitarian future-America holds an annual nationally televised event in which two children from each of its regions fight to the death until only one remains. A teenage girl takes her younger sister's place in the games and must pit her wits against the deadly combat skills of her rivals. Sci-fi adventure based on Suzanne Collins' novel, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Josh Hutcherson, Woody Harrelson and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: The Kings of Summer
programme.desc: Premiere. Three teenagers tire of abiding by their parents' rules, so decide to build their own house deep in a forest where they can live free of any outside authority. Their idyllic summer puts their friendship to the test as they learn that freedom comes at a cost. Comedy drama, starring Nick Robinson, Gabriel Basso and Moises Arias.(n)

programme.title: American Graffiti
programme.desc: On a late summer's night in 1962, four small-town California teenagers in their final year at senior high decide to celebrate their friendship with one last night on the town, before the responsibilities of adulthood close in on them and they go their separate ways. Coming-of-age comedy drama, based on director George Lucas's teenage years, starring Richard Dreyfuss, Ron Howard, Paul Le Mat, Charlie Martin Smith and Harrison Ford.(n)

programme.title: Arrietty
programme.desc: A family of tiny people lives beneath the floorboards of a Tokyo house, scavenging from the human occupants and carefully keeping their presence a secret. However, when their daughter is seen by a boy staying there, the friendship that develops raises the dangerous possibility of other humans finding out about them. Animated fantasy based on The Borrowers, with the voices of Saoirse Ronan and Tom Holland.(n)

programme.title: Unbroken Interview Special
programme.desc: Angelina Jolie discusses making her directorial debut with the fact-based Second World War drama, and Jack O'Connell talks about his role in the film.(n)

programme.title: Coraline
programme.desc: A bored youngster finds a secret door leading to a magical world inhabited by idealised versions of her family and neighbours. Frustrated with her dull real life, she is tempted to stay in this new home - but she soon discovers there is a horrifying price to be paid. Stop-motion animated fantasy based on Neil Gaiman's novel, with the voices of Dakota Fanning and Teri Hatcher.(n)

credits.actor: Ian McShane (Mr Sergei Alexander Bobinsky/Other Bobinsky)

programme.title: Dragonball Evolution
programme.desc: An ordinary teenager is recruited by a mystical martial arts master for a vitally important quest. He must find seven magical spheres before they fall into the hands of an evil warlord, who intends to use their power to let him take over the world. Fantasy adventure based on the Japanese cartoon series, starring Justin Chatwin, Chow Yun-Fat and James Marsters. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: New in Town
programme.desc: A Miami business executive accepts a temporary assignment helping to downsize a manufacturing plant in a small Minnesota town. Despite a frosty reception, she soon finds herself warming to the community and falling in love with the man of her dreams - until she is asked to do the unthinkable. Romantic comedy, starring Renee Zellweger, Harry Connick Jr and JK Simmons. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything Special
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the biopic of Stephen Hawking, starring Eddie Redmayne and Felicity Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader
programme.desc: Lucy and Edmund Pevensie return to the magical world accompanied by their selfish cousin. They join their old friend King Caspian as he sets sail across the sea in search of seven of his father's allies who had been banished years before, but along the way they discover an evil force is growing in strength. Fantasy adventure, with Georgie Henley, Skandar Keynes, Will Poulter and Ben Barnes.(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: A team of commandos enters a top-secret underground research facility when a deadly virus which turns victims into flesh-eating zombies is accidentally released. But their containment mission spins out of control as a rogue super-intelligent computer and hordes of the marauding undead wreak havoc. Sci-fi action horror, starring Milla Jovovich, Michelle Rodriguez and James Purefoy.(n)

programme.title: Lawless
programme.desc: Three brothers run an underground bootlegging operation in Depression-era Virginia. However, as their criminal activities become increasingly successful, a corrupt deputy sheriff demands a cut of the profits, forcing them to fight to defend their livelihood. Crime drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Tom Hardy, Jason Clarke, Gary Oldman and Guy Pearce.(n)

programme.title: 10 Years
programme.desc: Old friends wrestle with personal problems at their 10th high-school reunion. A man planning to propose to his girlfriend has second thoughts when he runs into the love of his teen years, a former bully tries to make amends but ends up reverting to his old ways, and a famous rock star is still too shy to talk to the girl he used to have a crush on. Comedy drama, starring Channing Tatum and Rosario Dawson.(n)

programme.title: A Ticket to Tomahawk
programme.desc: The daughter of a railway pioneer sets out to prove her trains can beat a rival's stagecoaches to the same destination. However, the competition is marred by a campaign of dirty tricks, and the locomotive passengers - a travelling salesman and a chorus of showgirls - get dragged into the conflict. Comedy Western, starring Dan Dailey, Anne Baxter, Arthur Hunnicutt and Walter Brennan.(n)

programme.title: The Theory of Everything Special
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of the biopic of Stephen Hawking, starring Eddie Redmayne and Felicity Jones.(n)

programme.title: Leap Year
programme.desc: A woman plans to take advantage of an Irish tradition to propose to her boyfriend while on holiday in Dublin. When they become separated, she faces a disastrous journey across the country in the company of a charming local innkeeper, and is tempted to leave her boyfriend for her travelling companion. Romantic comedy, starring Amy Adams, Matthew Goode and Adam Scott. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: Scientist Trevor Anderson sets out to locate his missing explorer brother after receiving a book charting his last journey. Accompanied by his nephew and an Icelandic guide, he is led to a mountain peak, where he stumbles across a system of caves leading to a lost underground world. Fantasy adventure, starring Brendan Fraser, Josh Hutcherson and Anita Briem.(n)

programme.title: Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events
programme.desc: Three orphans are entrusted into the care of their sinister uncle, a master of disguise who intends to kill them for the family fortune. Quickly realising he is up to no good, the children flee, moving from one prospective guardian to the next - but their wily relative is never far behind. Comedy adventure based on the children's books, starring Jim Carrey, Meryl Streep, Jude Law, Liam Aitken and Emily Browning, with Kara and Shelby Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Tower Heist
programme.desc: The manager of an apartment complex asks a Wall Street financier to manage pension funds for him and his friends, but the man pockets all the money instead. When he realises the fraudster is going to get away with the crime and the money will never be found, he enlists the help of a professional thief to steal it back. Crime comedy, with Ben Stiller, Eddie Murphy, Alan Alda, Tea Leoni, Casey Affleck and Matthew Broderick. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriend's father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard.(n)

credits.actor: John Tui (Chief Petty Officer Walter Lynch)

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: A cockney lothario leads a charmed life, enjoying casual sex with as many women as possible with no thought of the consequences. However, a series of unexpected setbacks forces him to finally take stock of his life. Comedy drama based on the play by Bill Naughton, starring Michael Caine, Jane Asher, Millicent Martin, Shirley Anne Field, Shelley Winters and Denholm Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Wrong Turn 2: Dead End
programme.desc: An army veteran starts a showbiz career, hosting a reality TV show where contestants are challenged to survive in the wilderness for six days. However, the latest entrants end up fighting for their lives against a family of bloodthirsty mutants with an insatiable hunger for human flesh. Horror sequel, starring Henry Rollins and Erica Leerhsen.(n)

programme.title: Prince Valiant
programme.desc: A Christian Viking prince is invited to King Arthur's court, where he discovers the most trusted man at Camelot is hatching a fiendish plot to bring about the demise of the king and the Knights of the Round Table. Adventure, based on the newspaper comic-strip by Hal Foster, starring Robert Wagner, Janet Leigh, James Mason, Debra Paget and Sterling Hayden.(n)

programme.title: Against the Wind
programme.desc: A Belgian priest living in exile in Britain during the Second World War becomes a secret agent for the Allies, but his first mission is a disaster, leading to the capture of a resistance leader. Four soldiers are sent into occupied France to rescue the insurgent, but begin to realise they have a traitor in their midst. Thriller, starring Jack Warner and Simone Signoret.(n)

programme.title: Decision at Sundown
programme.desc: A gunslinger rides into a backwoods town intent on finding his dead wife's former lover and exacting revenge for her death. The man he blames now has total control of the town and has the sheriff at his beck and call. Undeterred, the drifter offers his enemy an ultimatum - he has until sundown to leave the town or face retribution for his crimes. Western, with Randolph Scott, John Carroll and Andrew Duggan.(n)

programme.title: Cat Ballou
programme.desc: A schoolteacher returns to her home town to find a ruthless railroad developer is trying to snatch her family's land. When her father is murdered by a hitman for refusing to sell his ranch, she resolves to defend the property, enlisting the aid of two small-time crooks and a drunken gunslinger with an equally inebriated horse. Musical comedy Western, starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin, with music by Nat King Cole and Stubby Kaye.(n)

credits.actor: Nat King Cole (Professor Sam the Shade)

programme.title: Eclipse
programme.desc: Bella Swan's confused feelings for vampire Edward and werewolf Jacob threaten to ignite a conflict between the two supernatural races. Meanwhile, a series of murders heralds the return of an old enemy, who has raised an army to aid her quest for revenge. Third part of the romantic fantasy series, with Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, Taylor Lautner and Bryce Dallas Howard. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.title: Unknown
programme.desc: A doctor on a business trip in Germany ends up in a coma after a car accident. He wakes up to find another man is claiming to be him, his wife does not recognise him and any evidence of his real identity has disappeared. He seeks the help of the woman who saved his life as he tries to find out what has happened. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Diane Kruger and January Jones.(n)

programme.title: Bully
programme.desc: A violent and sadistic bully makes life a misery for other teenagers, pushes around his so-called best friend and rapes a local girl. Eventually, his victims all band together to have him killed, hiring an incompetent hitman to do the job. But things do not go entirely as they planned. Fact-based drama from Kids director Larry Clark. Starring Brad Renfro, Rachel Miner, Bijou Phillips and Nick Stahl.(n)
